dojg.description: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.

examples.japanese: (ksa).さんざん迷った末に、友達の結婚祝いはコーヒーカップのセットを贈ることにした。
examples.english: After much hesitation, I decided to give my friends a set of  coffee cups as a wedding present.

examples.japanese: (ksb).試行錯誤の末(に)、やっと車に使える燃料電池ができた。
examples.english: After much trial and error, we ﬁnally made a fuel cell battery  that can be used in cars.

examples.japanese: (a).一週間悩んだ末(に)、家族をおいて単身赴任することにした。
examples.english: After considering it for a week, I decided to leave my family  behind and transfer to my new job alone.

examples.japanese: (b).両者は8時間にわたる交渉の末に、ついに合意に達した。
examples.english: After eight hours of negotiation, both parties ﬁnally came to  an agreement.

examples.japanese: (c).5時間を超える熱戦の末、タイガースが勝った。
examples.english: After a close game lasting more than ﬁve hours, the Tigers won.

examples.japanese: (d).M銀行とU銀行の合併交渉は１年以上も難航した末、やっと成立した。
examples.english: After more than a year of difﬁcult merger negotiations, M Bank  and U Bank ﬁnally came to an agreement.

examples.japanese: (e).下書きを20枚近く失敗した末に、やっとなんとか気に入った絵ができた。
examples.english: After almost twenty bad sketches, I finally managed to draw one  I liked.

examples.japanese: (f).再就職は、苦労した末、過去のコンピュータ経験を評価してくれたIT関係の会社に決まりました。
examples.english: After much trouble looking for a new job, I found one with an  IT-related company that valued my previous computer experience.

examples.japanese: (g).男は走って逃げ、最後には暴れ回って抵抗した末に逮捕された。
examples.english: The man tried to run away and, in the end, he was arrested  after resisting violently.

examples.japanese: (h).この案は、各国の意見が衝突した末の「妥協の産物」だった。
examples.english: This plan was a product of compromise, reached after working  through a clash of opinions between the countries.

dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)Nounの
- 末(に)
- 今月の末(に)
- At the end of this month
- 交渉の末(に)
- After negotiation
- (ii)Vinformal past
- 末(に)
- よく考えた末(に)
- After thinking hard
dojg.related: 【Related Expression: あと(で); のち(に); あげく(に)】
